tournament.name: Tuesday 3rd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt your opponent's game plan, along with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to apply pressure, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until you can establish a dominant position on the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through flickering permanents for even more card advantage and tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on a strategy of cycling cards quickly to build up a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Memory Leak, Go for Blood, and Boon of the Wish-Giver, the deck can consistently cycle through its library to find key cards like Zenith Flare. Creatures like Flourishing Fox, Drannith Stinger, and Valiant Rescuer help support this aggressive playstyle, while the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard. The mana base is focused on providing ample resources for casting spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies using cycling cards to quickly cycle through the deck, powering up Zenith Flare as a finisher. It includes a companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, to provide additional value by allowing cards with converted mana cost 2 or less to be cast from the graveyard. The deck includes a mix of cycling cards, creatures with cycling abilities, and cards that benefit from cycling, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct damage from Zenith Flare.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, removal, hand disruption, and planeswalkers. By efficiently managing resources and consistently answering threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a war of attrition. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility through blinking permanents for extra card advantage and board control. This deck excels in grinding out long games and ultimately overwhelming the opponent with incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Time Wipe while maintaining tempo with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain board presence. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Agent of Treachery and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling while generating card advantage with Fblthp, the Lost and Elite Guardmage. The deck can also generate value by blinking key creatures with Yorion, Sky Nomad.

This control deck aims to maximize the value of Fires of Invention by casting spells for free, using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to control the board and draw cards. The deck also runs a few big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith to close out games quickly. By ramping up with Fabled Passage and mana-fixing lands, the deck can consistently hit its key cards and overwhelm opponents with a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to play high impact spells and creatures for free, while controlling the game with powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck aims to stabilize the board with Bonecrusher Giant and Cavalier of Flame, while generating card advantage with Sphinx of Foresight. Kenrith, the Returned King provides versatility and a powerful late-game threat, supported by Brazen Borrower for tempo plays. The companion Keruga, the Macrosage ensures a consistent source of card draw to help maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free. This enables the player to quickly establish board presence with powerful creatures like Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and control spells, ultimately securing victory through superior board presence and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Lukka, along with removal spells like Glass Casket and Elspeth Conquers Death. By utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, the deck can quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents. The addition of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra advantage. With a strong mix of card advantage, removal, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game from start to finish.

This deck aims to control the board with spells such as Omen of the Forge, Deafening Clarion, and Elspeth Conquers Death while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. The deck also focuses on card advantage and card selection with Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea, along with powerful finishers like Archon of Sun's Grace and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a way to flicker key permanents for additional value.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to control the board and draw cards, the deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The inclusion of Fae of Wishes allows for additional versatility and access to sideboard cards, providing even more control and flexibility in different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful cards like Fires of Invention and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also utilizing the companion Keruga, the Macrosage for card advantage. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Deafening Clarion, alongside powerful threats such as Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with a mix of shock lands and triomes. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on and eventually overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to pump up Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, while also controlling the opponent's options with Memory Leak. Zenith Flare serves as a powerful finisher, especially when paired with Boon of the Wish-Giver. Valiant Rescuer can create a board presence quickly, and Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for extra value by bringing back cheap creatures from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells while maintaining card advantage through cycling.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to trigger abilities that deal damage, create tokens, and gain life. By utilizing cards like Flourishing Fox, Drannith Stinger, and Improbable Alliance, the player can build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to cycle through the deck efficiently, while protecting key creatures and landing powerful finishers like Zenith Flare. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard, ensuring a continuous stream of threats for the opponent to deal with.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly build up a board presence and deal direct damage to the opponent. By cycling through cards like Startling Development and Frostveil Ambush, the player can trigger abilities like Zenith Flare and Drannith Stinger multiple times, allowing for explosive bursts of damage. The inclusion of creatures like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer further enhances the cycling strategy, creating a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through your deck to maintain card advantage and build up a large board presence. By utilizing cards that allow you to cycle through your deck efficiently, combined with cards that benefit from cycling, such as Zenith Flare, Drannith Stinger, and Valiant Rescuer, you can overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggro creatures and burn spells. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion, providing additional value by allowing you to recur your low-cost cycling creatures from your graveyard.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain board presence through cards like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Rotting Regisaur. The addition of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion allows for increased damage output to quickly close out games. Castle Locthwain provides card draw to help maintain momentum, while cards like Drill Bit and Murderous Rider offer disruption and removal options to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to win by attacking relentlessly and outpacing the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to stabilize the board. The goal is to ramp up mana quickly with cards such as Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, while also generating value with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to win by casting powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon to close out the game. The deck's mana base is designed to support its three-color identity, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and generating value through card advantage and mana acceleration. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wilderness Reclamation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the late game. With a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck can adapt to different situations and come out on top through sheer card advantage and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and outlasting opponents using Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana and untap lands, while utilizing counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire to handle threats. The deck has a strong late game with Shark Typhoon as a win condition, supported by powerful card draw in Growth Spiral and Expansion / Explosion. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides consistent card advantage and a strong creature presence. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and gradually grind out a win through card advantage and powerful plays.

The deck focuses on establishing control through counterspells and removal while generating card advantage with Narset and Teferi. It aims to stall the game with board wipes and tempo plays until it can resolve its powerful finishers like Dream Trawler and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad is included as a Companion to provide additional value with its blinking effect. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency, with a mix of lands that produce both white and blue mana. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a slow, methodical manner.

This deck focuses on using Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery and Bonecrusher Giant early in the game. By including cards like Raise the Alarm and Fblthp, the Lost to create tokens and trigger Winota's ability, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive start. Teferi, Time Raveler and Shark Typhoon provide additional control and flexibility, while cards like Charming Prince and Brazen Borrower offer utility and disruption. The deck's mana base is set up to support its multicolor cards and ensure consistent casting of spells.
